page.title: 01Povington & Grange Heaths.
page.content: This block is partially inside the Lulworth army gunnery ranges and has reverted to natural heath (except for tank tracks & targets). The western portion is largely wooded both with conifers (squares 2,3,4) and mixed deciduous woodland (squares 7 & 8) and contains the only public road in block. The very steep ridge of the purbeck hills crosses squares 9, 10, 11, & 12 almost from east to west standing 45 metres above the steeple valley to the south. Maximum height is 60.6 metres at grange arch (sq 12), a folly constructed by the owner of Creech Grance (sq 8). At the extreme southern border of the block is the tiny hamlet of Steeple (church in next block). There are no amenities in the block but a good deal of clay mining - particularly in squares 5,6, & 7.
